examples: These arguments provide the foundation for Simmel's account of the contradictory nature of modern life.
His argument rests on shaky ground.
The lawyer presented the right argument in court.
Your article barely laid a glove on my arguments.
He would start an argument at the drop of a hat.
words.defineEn: a discussion, typically a serious one, between two or more people with different views
words.defineVi: một cuộc thảo luận, điển hình là một cuộc thảo luận nghiêm túc, giữa hai hoặc nhiều người có quan điểm khác nhau

examples: You've been complaining all day.
He complained of being kept out of the loop and threatened to resign.
The procrastinator complained about not having enough time to pursue their hobbies, but idle folk have the least leisure, and their lack of productivity left them with little free time.
When the teacher complained about the boys' rowdy behavior, the principal dismissed it by saying that boys will be boys.
She was getting sick of hearing him complain.
words.defineEn: to express one's annoyance, unhappiness, or dissatisfaction about something
words.defineVi: để bày tỏ sự khó chịu, bất hạnh, hoặc không hài lòng của một người về một cái gì đó

examples: I was too nervous to eat.
I felt a bit nervous when the elevator suddenly stopped between floors.
I was nervous before my dental appointment, but the dentist made me feel comfortable.
He grew nervous about the deal and asked his bank manager to stop the cheque.
I was pretty nervous to start with, but after a while I was fine.
words.defineEn: (of a reaction or situation) indicating a feeling of agitation or nervousness
words.defineVi: (của một phản ứng hoặc tình huống) cho thấy cảm giác kích động hoặc lo lắng

examples: Aren't you pleased to see me?
And didn't he just sound pleased as punch about that?
The artist didn't have any particular outcome in mind when she started painting, but was pleased with the final result.
It was safe to say I was pleased to see the back of it!
The artist was pleased when her painting sold for a high price at the gallery.
words.defineEn: feeling happy and satisfied with something that has happened or with someone's actions
words.defineVi: cảm thấy hạnh phúc và hài lòng với điều gì đó đã xảy ra hoặc với hành động của ai đó

examples: Don't be scared to speak to him.
He watched a scary movie and got scared during the suspenseful scenes.
I was really scared when I encountered a bear in the wilderness.
You've got your rivals running scared.
The young boy was scared of the rocking boat at first, but his grandfather helped him find his sea legs and they spent the day fishing together.
words.defineEn: afraid of something or someone
words.defineVi: sợ một cái gì đó hoặc một ai đó

examples: Under stress, the body produces adrenalin.
If you keep working so hard, the stress will eventually take its toll.
The stress of the job caused him to fall to pieces and have panic attacks.

Michael stressed over the prospect of finding a new school for his autistic son yet again after two moves in three years, knowing that three moves are as bad as a fire for his son's specialized educational needs.
What is stressed rather is that the same phenomenon provides the foundation for both historical tendencies.
words.defineEn: (psychology) a mental state of worry caused by physical or emotional tension
words.defineVi: (tâm lý học) trạng thái tinh thần lo lắng do căng thẳng về thể chất hoặc tinh thần

examples: She was surprised to find Chinese cabbage at the grocery store.
I'm really surprised that the sequel even holds a candle to the original.
When I tasted the white sauce for the first time, I was pleasantly surprised by its delicate balance of flavors.
She was surprised to find that everyone had left.
Mark was surprised to find out that his close friend, Alex, swings both ways.
words.defineEn: feeling or showing surprise or wonder
words.defineVi: cảm thấy hoặc thể hiện sự ngạc nhiên hoặc thắc mắc

examples: Police are worried that many crimes go unreported.
I'm not worried about my finances.
She was worried she was stuck in a dead-end job.
I'm worried that I didn't give a good account of myself in that job interview today.
I’m not worried about stepping on anybody’s toes.
words.defineEn: feeling unhappy and afraid because of something that has happened or might happen
words.defineVi: cảm thấy không vui và sợ hãi vì điều gì đó đã xảy ra hoặc có thể xảy ra

examples: He was amazed that she would have the gall to show herself.
I'm amazed that he lets them lead him around by the nose like that.
He was amazed by the high price tag on the caviar, realizing it was a luxury out of his reach.
Johnny's friends were amazed at how much he could eat when they went out to eat.
I asked, amazed.
words.defineEn: feeling or displaying great surprise
words.defineVi: cảm thấy hoặc hiển thị sự ngạc nhiên lớn

examples: I know you're annoyed to have gotten another parking ticket, but that's life.
I was, to put it mildly, annoyed.
Mom already seemed annoyed, but the fat really hit the fire when she found out that you'd been lying to her.
I'm annoyed.
It's actually spelled annoyed grunt.
words.defineEn: being angry to some extent
words.defineVi: tức giận ở một mức độ nào đó

examples: Taylor was bitterly disappointed to be dropped from the England side.
I'm disappointed about their decision, but I'm not losing any sleep over it.
I'm disappointed that I didn't get the job but that's the way the cookie crumbles.
We were left feeling rather disappointed.
I know you're disappointed, but you need to roll up your sleeves and redouble your efforts.
words.defineEn: not satisfied with something, especially because one expected otherwise
words.defineVi: không hài lòng với một cái gì đó, đặc biệt là bởi vì một mong đợi khác

examples: Alan looks embarrassed.
She felt embarrassed when her coworkers laughed at her proposal during the meeting.
He was embarrassed by his moobs while taking off his shirt at the beach.
I wanted to shout at the man for jumping the line, but I was too embarrassed about making a scene.
I was so embarrassed when Danny started throwing a fit in the grocery store.
words.defineEn: feeling ashamed and uncomfortable because of something that happened or was said. especially in front of other people
words.defineVi: cảm thấy xấu hổ và không thoải mái vì điều gì đó đã xảy ra hoặc đã được nói ra. đặc biệt là trước mặt người khác

examples: The exhausted runner flopped onto the ground after crossing the finish line.
That's why we're all exhausted today.
I'm sorry, Mimi, I'm just too exhausted to go out tonight.
He's fresh out of a long road trip and feeling exhausted from the journey.

Despite feeling discouraged and exhausted after months of job searching, Mary remained committed to her career goals by remembering that it is dogged that does it, and ultimately landed her dream job.
words.defineEn: completely drained of energy, often due to physical or mental exertion
words.defineVi: hoàn toàn cạn kiệt năng lượng, thường là do gắng sức về thể chất hoặc tinh thần

examples: Her emotions are an open book.
Love is a complex emotion that can bring immense joy and deep sorrow.
I always feel a mix of emotions when saying goodbye to loved ones at the airport.
When the judge announced the decision, the balloon went up, and emotions ran high in the courtroom.
It’s flesh and blood to feel such strong emotions at this time.
words.defineEn: a strong feeling such as love, anger, etc.
words.defineVi: một cảm giác mạnh mẽ như tình yêu, giận dữ, vv

examples: The drug produces a feeling of excitement.
The child jumped up and down with excitement.
The crowd erupted into cries of excitement when their favorite band took the stage.
He learned to check his excitement.
Excitement was coursing through her blood ever more fiercely as she got closer to seeing her sister.
words.defineEn: a feeling of much enthusiasm and happiness
words.defineVi: một cảm giác rất nhiệt tình và hạnh phúc

examples: As frightened as I am to die, I'm also curious to know what it's like beyond the veil.
The villagers are very frightened of his ghost.
Mr Edgar looked very frightened.
I was kind of frightened.
I was definitely frightened.
words.defineEn: feeling afraid or anxious
words.defineVi: cảm thấy sợ hãi hoặc lo lắng

examples: I would be grateful if you could call me back at your earliest convenience.
We should be grateful for the opportunities and blessings in our lives, and not focus on what we lack.
Although Sarah wasn't able to attend the event, her friends were grateful for her sincere apologies, and decided to take the will for the deed.

The heartbroken man consoled himself with the thought that it is better to have loved and lost than never to have loved at all - he was grateful for the memories and experiences he had shared with his former partner.
Mark wasn't happy with his first draft of the book, but he's grateful for the chance to take a second bite at the cherry and revise it before submitting it to publishers.
words.defineEn: displaying or expressing thanks because someone has done something for one
words.defineVi: hiển thị hoặc bày tỏ sự cảm ơn vì ai đó đã làm điều gì đó cho một người

examples: The company is keen to get the idea over.
Her mother, Louise, was very keen on keeping up with the Joneses.
Susan has a keen eye for detail, so each dress is beautifully finished off.
After his latest brush with infamy, the footballer is keen to stay out of the tabloids and is keeping a low profile.
Everyone seemed full of beans, looking forward to breakfast, and keen to find out their group's activities for the day.
words.defineEn: (of senses) sharp and highly-developed
words.defineVi: (của các giác quan) nhạy bén và phát triển cao

examples: Phobia sufferers often find themselves virtual prisoners in their own home.
Phobias are an intense fear of an object or situation.
But people have phobias of all kinds of other animals.
Phobias aren’t uncommon, either.
Some common phobias include spiders, getting shots, or public speaking.
words.defineEn: a great fear of an object or situation that is irrational
words.defineVi: một nỗi sợ hãi lớn về một đối tượng hoặc tình huống không hợp lý

examples: Her work has given pleasure to millions of readers.
She takes pleasure in her work.
The books in the library are available for checkout at their pleasure.
The murderer was imprisoned at His Majesty's pleasure.
I'm just going to find pleasure in perfect little moments like this.
words.defineEn: a feeling of great enjoyment and happiness
words.defineVi: một cảm giác vô cùng thích thú và hạnh phúc

examples: The company's ex-CEO was known for his aggressive management style.
The normally reserved and polite man became aggressive and confrontational when he was drunk, revealing a darker side of his personality.
The two lawyers were both known for their aggressive tactics, so when they faced each other in court, it was a case of when Greek meets Greek, then comes the tug of war.
The squirrels got aggressive, a hallmark of frustration.
Windows updates are notoriously aggressive.
words.defineEn: behaving in an angry way and having a tendency to be violent
words.defineVi: cư xử một cách tức giận và có xu hướng bạo lực

examples: But by 2015, American businesses and government officials were increasingly alarmed.
Christina Frederick-Trosper, the teacher from Knox County, was alarmed.
Jack was kind of alarmed.
Between 1890 and 1950 alarmed citizens petitioned their state and local governments to create a detailed regulatory system of sexual line drawing.
Hopefully won't get too alarmed, but they'll hopefully be alright.
words.defineEn: worrying about or fearing something
words.defineVi: lo lắng về hoặc sợ hãi một cái gì đó

examples: The magician brought the house down with their amazing tricks, leaving the audience gasping in amazement.
In Israel, Netanyahu expressed amazement at what Obama had done.
I always watch this in such amazement.
I was so hurt by her amazement that tears came to my eyes.

When he fell, I think the amazement of Mubarak and his people that America deserted them openly, and the amazement of many allies of America, leaders in the region, that America seemed not to be a reliable ally and pushes you when they need at least not to interfere.
words.defineEn: a feeling of extreme surprise or wonder
words.defineVi: một cảm giác cực kỳ ngạc nhiên hoặc ngạc nhiên

examples: My anxiety usually keeps me from taking time by the forelock.
Leave it to anxiety to put a situation out of perspective.
Jane's parents were worried about her anxiety, but they knew that care is no cure and encouraged her to seek professional help.
John was a silent sufferer, never letting on to his colleagues that he was struggling with anxiety and depression.
He took to practicing yoga every morning to help him manage his stress and anxiety.
words.defineEn: a feeling of nervousness or worry that one might have about an uncertain outcome in the future
words.defineVi: một cảm giác hồi hộp hoặc lo lắng mà một người có thể có về một kết quả không chắc chắn trong tương lai

examples: You're so anxious to keep your children out of harm's way that you're going to end up denying them a lot of valuable life experiences.
I used to get really anxious about the future, but then I started reminding myself that every day brings its bread.
I think we all have been sitting on pins and needles and anxious for something to happen.
Sarah was always striving for more success and recognition at work, but she found herself constantly stressed and anxious.
Sarah tends to dwell on her mistakes, which makes her feel anxious and insecure.
words.defineEn: feeling nervous or worried because of thinking something unpleasant might happen
words.defineVi: cảm thấy lo lắng hoặc lo lắng vì nghĩ rằng điều gì đó khó chịu có thể xảy ra

examples: Peter ought to be ashamed of himself.
Narcissists aren’t really that ashamed.
I was ashamed.
- I am ashamed of myself.
Peter felt ashamed.
words.defineEn: feeling embarrassed or sorry about a characteristic or about having done something wrong
words.defineVi: cảm thấy xấu hổ hoặc xin lỗi về một đặc điểm hoặc về việc đã làm sai điều gì đó

examples: Of what?' asked the astonished father.
'Here?' repeated Bounderby, more astonished than ever.
words.defineEn: feeling very surprised or impressed, especially because of an unexpected event
words.defineVi: cảm thấy rất ngạc nhiên hoặc ấn tượng, đặc biệt là vì một sự kiện bất ngờ

examples: It's going to be awkward, to say the least.
This is awkward.
This is awkward.
that was awkward.
This is awkward.
words.defineEn: making one feel embarrassed or uncomfortable
words.defineVi: làm cho một người cảm thấy xấu hổ hoặc không thoải mái

examples: Or die of boredom.
The opposite of that is boredom, where you have low challenges with the mid-range skills.
Is it just pure boredom?
Boredom with your routine task can also sink your spirit and your motivation.
And stress and boredom and loneliness affects the mind.
words.defineEn: the quality of being boring; the state of being bored
words.defineVi: chất lượng nhàm chán; tình trạng buồn chán

examples: A curious sheep approached me and sniffed my hand.
Despite the danger, the explorers were curious about what lay beyond the mountains.
As frightened as I am to die, I'm also curious to know what it's like beyond the veil.
After being told not to read a particular book, Susan found herself more curious about it, as the forbidden fruit is the sweetest.
James is a bright and curious boy who loves exploring nature and asking questions.
words.defineEn: unusual or strange in a way that is unexpected
words.defineVi: khác thường hoặc lạ theo cách bất ngờ

examples: She felt drunk with rage.
He was foaming at the mouth with rage.
She flew into rage and suddenly slapped me!
Harold had worked himself into a minor rage.
The book is "Rage."
words.defineEn: great anger that is hard to contain
words.defineVi: sự tức giận lớn khó có thể kiềm chế
